newsitem.title: CHINA: Yaohua says good management helps profit.
newsitem.headline: Yaohua says good management helps profit.

text.p: Shanghai Yaohua Pilkington Glass Co Ltd said on Tuesday that good management kept the company profitable in 1996 despite fierce competition in the glass industry.
The company said in its annual report that 1996 net profit slid to 80.39 million yuan from 189.76 million yuan in 1995, under international accounting standards.
Under domestic accounting standards, the net was 113.56 million yuan against 263.193 million yuan, the report, published in the Shanghai Securities News, said.
Earnings per share dropped to 0.23 yuan in 1996 against 0.67 yuan in 1995, based on domestic accounting standards, it said.
Despite the sharp fall, the 1996 net profit was not easy to attain because of intensifying competition, the report said.

"Prompted by high returns, China's glass production had grown too fast in the previous two years, causing prices to plunge nationwide in 1996," the annual report said. "In addition, demand on the international market also fell in 1996."
The firm said its key task in 1996 was to maintain market share and keep its production line running at high capacity.
As a result, 1996 turnover was 589.535 million yuan against 646.435 million yuan in 1995, falling much less than profits.
"The firm also worked hard to develop its glass processing technology," the annual report said.
The company's board of directors proposed a cash dividend of 0.15 yuan per share based on the 1996 net, pending shareholder approval at a meeting scheduled for May 30, the report said.
